definition: to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

sentences.english: Remove chain drive wheel from crankshaft.
sentences.chinese: 從曲軸上拆下鏈條驅動輪。

sentences.english: The driving wheel may slip while starting or speeding up.
sentences.chinese: 在起步或加速時，驅動輪可能會打滑。

sentences.english: It'should only take me a few minutes to redirect the power to the drive wheels.
sentences.chinese: 應該只花我幾分鐘來改變能量到驅動輪上。

sentences.english: Through changes the driving gear and the driven wheel transmission belt's contact radius carries on the speed change.
sentences.chinese: 通過改變驅動輪與從動輪傳動帶的接觸半徑進行變速。

sentences.english: Worn main bearing from excessive tension on drive belt.
sentences.chinese: 驅動輪上的軸承因張力過大而損壞。

sentences.english: No small driving wheel, the company produced rubber mixing machine used in all bearing.
sentences.chinese: 無大小驅動輪，公司生產的煉膠機全部採用滾動軸承。

sentences.english: The relative speed between driving wheel and pin rail varies with sinusoidal function.
sentences.chinese: 驅動輪和銷軌的相對速度按正弦函數變化。
